title: Israel’s War Against Midian
summary: Numbers 31 recounts God’s command to take vengeance on the Midianites. Israel defeats them in battle, killing all the men and capturing women, children, and plunder. Moses is angry that the women were spared, and stricter orders are given. The plunder is divided among the warriors and the community, with offerings given to the Lord.

faq.question: Why did God command war on Midian?
faq.answer: Because the Midianites had led Israel into sin through idolatry and immorality at Peor.

faq.question: How was the plunder handled?
faq.answer: It was divided between the soldiers and the community, with a portion given as an offering to God.
